Class LynxController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.hardware.lynx.LynxCommExceptionHandler
      • com.qualcomm.hardware.lynx.LynxController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Engagable, HardwareDevice, HardwareDeviceHealth, RobotArmingStateNotifier, RobotArmingStateNotifier.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LynxAnalogInputController, LynxDcMotorController, LynxDigitalChannelController, LynxI2cDeviceSynch, LynxPwmOutputController, LynxServoController, LynxVoltageSensor

    public abstract class LynxController
extends LynxCommExceptionHandler
implements Engagable, HardwareDevice, HardwareDeviceHealth, RobotArmingStateNotifier.Callback, RobotArmingStateNotifier

      • registerCallback

        public void registerCallback(RobotArmingStateNotifier.Callback callback,
                             boolean doInitialCallback)
        Description copied from interface: RobotArmingStateNotifier
        Registers a callback for arming state notifications from this module. If this callback is already registered for notifications from this module, this method has no effect. Note that multiple callbacks may be simultaneously registered with a given one module: they all receive state-change notifications, in an arbitrary order.
        Specified by:
        registerCallback in interface RobotArmingStateNotifier
        See Also:
        RobotArmingStateNotifier.unregisterCallback(Callback)

      • unregisterCallback

        public void unregisterCallback(RobotArmingStateNotifier.Callback callback)
        Description copied from interface: RobotArmingStateNotifier
        Unregister a callback which has been registered for notifications with this module. If the callback was not previously registered, this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        unregisterCallback in interface RobotArmingStateNotifier
        See Also:
        RobotArmingStateNotifier.registerCallback(Callback, boolean)

      • getDeviceName

        public abstract java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        Description copied from interface: HardwareDevice
        Returns a string suitable for display to the user as to the type of device. Note that this is a device-type-specific name; it has nothing to do with the name by which a user might have configured the device in a robot configuration.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        device manufacturer and name
